member.name: T:Lumenera.Range`1
member.summary: Type to store the span (range) of a set of values. This is a value type (struct) because it is small and because it makes it easy for us to compare ranges. Note that all ranges are inclusive of their endpoints.

member.name: F:Lumenera.Range`1.Min
member.summary: Minimum of range.

member.name: F:Lumenera.Range`1.Max
member.summary: Maximum of range.

member.name: F:Lumenera.Range`1.Empty
member.summary: An unspecified range (a range of [0,0]).

member.name: M:Lumenera.Range`1.#ctor(`0,`0)
member.summary: Create a range with the specified minimum and maximum values.

member.name: M:Lumenera.Range`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: A degenerate case where the range collapses to an exact value.

member.name: M:Lumenera.Range`1.ToString
member.summary: Format the range as a string. Note that the range is inclusive so the textual representation of the range uses square brackets.
member.returns: The formatted string.

member.name: M:Lumenera.Range`1.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Format the range as a string. Note that the range is inclusive so the textual representation of the range uses square brackets.
member.returns: The formatted string.

member.name: T:Lumenera.Range
member.summary: Silly way to extend generic Range just because we can't add/compare generic type values. This instance is for double.
Silly way to extend generic Range just because we can't add/compare generic type values. This instance is for float.

Silly way to extend generic Range just because we can't add/compare generic type values. This instance is for int. Tolerance stuff doesn't really make sense for ints (well, I guess it does if they are large numbers).

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamImageFormatSize
member.summary: Can't use sizeof() on LucamImageFormat in C# so use this constant instead to initialize LucamImageFormat.size. Also, a struct can't have a parameterless constructor that just initializes the size and there are too many fields for a do-all constructor.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddRgbPreviewCallback(System.Int32,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamRgbPreviewCallback,System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPixelFormat)
member.summary: Register an RGB frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera. The frames have the selected demosaicing method and color correction matrices applied (so note that this function is more expensive to use than LucamAddStreamingCallback() which returns raw frames. If RGB is not needed for every frame consider using LucamAddStreamingCallback() and LucamConvertFrameToRgb24() for the frames that you do need converted into color format. The pixel format associated with the callback can be inspected with LucamQueryRgbPreviewPixelFormat().
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
Pixel format (must be LucamPixelFormat.PF_24 or PF_32).
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddSnapshotCallback(System.Int32,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamStreamingCallback,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Register a raw snapshot frame event callback.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveSnapshotCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.summary: Register a raw stream video frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.summary: No Error (success)

member.summary: Snapshot not supported for this model (aka still, aka fast frames).

member.summary: Pixel format requested is not valid.

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamError.SubsamplingZero
member.summary: A subsampling of zero was passed to a function. The subsampling (or binning) factor must be a positive integer - 1, 2, 4

member.summary: Lucam API is busy. A retry of this call after a small delay may succeed.

member.summary: Setting the requested subsampling in LucamFrameFormat failed. Could be due to DirectShow filter not being installed.

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamError.FailedToSetStartPosition
member.summary: Setting the image offset in LucamFrameFormat failed.

member.summary: Pixel format requested is not supported by this camera.

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamError.InvalidFrameFormat

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamError.PreparationFailed
member.summary: The API failed to prepare the camera for streaming or snapshot. If START_STREAMING succeeds and START_DISPLAY fails with this error, this can be due to a DirectShow filter not being installed.

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamError.CannotRun
member.summary: The API failed to get the camera running. This can be due to a bandwidth problem.

member.name: F:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamError.NotRunning
member.summary: The function failed because it requires the camera to be running, and it is not.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.AddRgbPreviewCallback(System.Int32,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamRgbPreviewCallback,System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPixelFormat)
member.summary: Register an RGB frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera. The frames have the selected demosaicing method and color correction matrices applied (so note that this function is more expensive to use than LucamAddStreamingCallback() which returns raw frames. If RGB is not needed for every frame consider using LucamAddStreamingCallback() and LucamConvertFrameToRgb24() for the frames that you do need converted into color format. The pixel format associated with the callback can be inspected with LucamQueryRgbPreviewPixelFormat().
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
Pixel format (must be LucamPixelFormat.PF_24 or PF_32).
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.summary: Deregister an RGB frame event callback.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.TakeSynchronousSnapshots(System.Int32,System.Byte[][])
member.summary: Take synchronous snapshots.
member.param: Array of raw image buffers for the snapshot images. These buffers must correspond in size to the LucamFrameFormat for that camera. The byte[][] type is a sparse array (an array of arrays) which requires that each of the first dimension (leftmost index) be initialized with a byte array (e.g. new byte[imageSize]). This approach allows the buffers to vary in size according to the camera type and settings in use for each camera.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.DisableSynchronousSnapshots(System.Int32)
member.summary: Release the synchronous snapshot handle.
